Reviews.Title: “19 hours to kill in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Renee A
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at AC Hotel Atocha (9/3-9/4) the hotel room was very modern and clean. Shower was amazing. Walk in shower with a waterfall shower head over your head. I felt like I was showering in a box of mirrors. You had three options when showering...1. waterfall 2. shower head or 3. three powerful jets coming straight at you. Location is pretty close to Plaza Mayor have to catch the metro get off at Puerto del Sol which is 5 to 7 minute in walking distance to Plaza Mayor. I would personally stay here again great value and good location in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Stylish....but not to central”
Reviews.Author: ARMNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night only 8/18 to 8/19 2012. What you see in the hotel web-page (photos) is how the hotel looks, modern and fairly new. The location is so so..... walking distance from Atocha Station, 2 or 3 long blocks....ok during day time, kind of quite at night....the area is residencial w/ restaurants, bars, stores etc. for the locals, not touristy at all .... 1 or 2 stops by metro from Atocha to the center of Madrid (Sol). This hotel in my oppinion is great for over night stay, business travelers or for someone who wants quite location away from touristy areas. The rooms are modern, clean, stylish decor (very nice and unique shower) confortable beds great to relax....nice desk to work, safe;.... in general "very nice rooms"; also remember the AC hotels offer in their rooms conplementary frige w/ water, sodas and beer. Pros.....confortable, modern contemporary decord in all areas.... great rooms w/ modern decor good for over night transit or business travelers,....near Atocha. Cons....in july and august slow business for the hotel the kitchen close not hot items for breakfast and no restaurant for lunch or dinner. Area not great for tourist I will recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Giles D
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was very clean and modern, quite thin but very long. Didn't contain a bath - would advise against booking if you prefer using a bath. Staff were polite and happy to assist and the free wifi in the reception is brilliant, a perfect place to relax. The real downside to this hotel is the location. It is perfect if you are using the Atocha train station, but beyond that it's not very helpful. Even the metro station is a good walk from the hotel. We got in at 9pm (on a Friday) to discover the restaurant was closed, and almost all the other restaurants in a five-six block area were shut as well. For business trips or outside the summer period I imagine it's a really useful hotel, but we didn't see it on show on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the station”
Reviews.Author: vivan79
Reviews.Content: we with a family stopped in this hotel for one night. The hotel is near the railway station. Nearby museum of Sofia. Numbers with extravagant registration. A shower cabin with translucent glasses. Free mini bar. Benevolent personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for easy access!”
Reviews.Author: abounatom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights using two rooms for sightseeing around Madrid before heading to the Costa del Sol. We took the express bus from the airport to the Atocha Train station and then were able to walk the short distance to the hotel with out luggage by cutting through the train station. The hotel is just a few minutes from the entrance to the train station. This saved a lot of money as we would have needed two taxis since we were five people. Likewise, we did a day trip on the train to Toledo and just walked over to the station, very convenient. When we left, we picked up our car from Avis, again at the station. No need to return to the airport and the fee was about 20 Euros less than picking up at the airport. From the hotel you can easily walk about 15 minutes to the Prado or Retiro Park. We took the Metro to the palace, but walked back, about 45 minutes or so. Everything is in walking distance if you are in decent shape. Rooms are what others have described-modern but nothing fancy and very small. Free Internet in the lobby and minibar is free as in all AC hotels. Price is very affordable compared to the others around the Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, and easy to park!”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethandCraig
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very beautiful, extremely spacious, and spotless. The bed was incredibly soft and the room had a very nice mini-bar and a really unique, wonderful retro shower in the middle of the room. The bathroom was separate and the room also had a very nice couch and work space. The hotel staff was cold at best, but the room was very nice regardless. The parking was very affordable and easy to find. We walked into the heart of the city, i.e. to the Prado and it was a quick, safe, wonderful walk to the heart of nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: debphill
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights, location is within walking distance to metro and train station. The hotel is in a residential neighborhood, so for siteseeing Madrid, you will have to hop on the metro. The hotel was very clean and nice selection of amenities. Our room was upgraded, so we did not have the clear glass shower, but the overhead rain type shower head was pretty cool. Restocked mini bar each day and had a nice selection of beverages. The restaurant was only open for breakfast which offered plentiful breakfast selections. For lunch or dinner, meal has to be ordered in the bar area. Nice outdoor seating off bar. The elevators are very small. If 2 people are in there with luggage, there would not be room for anyone else. TV selection offers english channels.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Bassammississauga
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is not for someone visiting downtown Madrid as it is far away from the nearest metro station. Be prepared for a lot of walking (25 minutes to the nearest metro station which is more time than the metro ride to the downtown area). This hotel is the most awkward hotel I have ever been. The rooms are in a different building and the amenities are in another building. The neighbourhood is very residential and sleeps very early. We could not have any meal in this area. Room: small but clean and well furnished with new and modern furniture. Establishment: New but badly designed. Breakfast: Very good Staff: Friendly Would I go back? No, I will pay more to be in the downtown area and save myself the commuting time. I actually found a cheaper and better hotel in the downtown area and changed hotels after two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Designer chic in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dec105
Reviews.Content: There's good value to be had for weekends in Madrid if you search about. AC Hotel Atocha proved particularly good value for a weekend in June - and the hotel quality certainly turned out to be a very good deal. The hotel is down by the side of Atocha station, Madrid's transport hub. Its neighbourhood,though, is more local Madrid and that bit away from the tourism maelstrom - lots of local bars and restaurants, at local prices and perhaps offering a better insight into the heart of Madrid than are maybe found in the more well known areas of the city. Hotel itself is quite new - clean and designer chic. The bedrooms are in a separate building, joined to the lobby area by a walkway and gardens. If you need time out, the garden and terrace provide a beautiful and private area where you can relax, read, have a drink or take the sun - a mini oasis, but only a stones-throw from downtown Madrid. The bedroom. What is the focal point of any hotel bedroom ? In AC Hotel, it's clearly the shower. A stylish, glass-walled shower sits proudly in the middle of the open plan bedroom, providing a divider between the bathroom area and the bedroom / living space. Lots of space in the shower, with a selection of water jets and power showers where - if that's your thing - you can lots of fun with water. Everything else in the room is clean, modern and stylish. There's a free wall safe, flat screen TV, a minibar with free soft drinks (plus one beer) but - alas - no free wi-fi (at least none thatI could find) Well woth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. They have a bus that will pick you up at the airport and take you there as well. Be sure to put you name on the list to reserve a place on the bus for your flight. The hotel is in a neighborhood next to a park. If you walk through the park and down the street to your left you will find a really nice shopping area with outdoor restaurants. Everyone is real laid back. There is a nice liquor store there you can buy a nice bottle of wine to take home. Tell Carlos there I said hello. He made a special wrap for my bottle of wine that I bought to bring home.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful hotel in the heart of Madrid (FOR COUPLES ONLY)”
Reviews.Author: Azzouni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and clean. The price was excellent. The only problem was that it should be a "couple-only" hotel as they have only glass showers that are visible inside the room. We were on a family vacation and got two rooms. When someone had to to take a shower, the others had to move to the other room! Other than that, the location is perfect; the neighborhood is very nice. You must visit the Sella bakery close by.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelplanner70
Reviews.Content: Although I found the staff to be very unfriendly, the hotel itself was adequate for our family. The rooms were very comfortable, and the complimentary mini bar was convenient. Location was good as we traveled with our sons, and they were very comfortable walking to the various museums/sites, and taking the metro on their own. They had twin beds in their room, and unlike the shower in our room, there were black panels about shoulder high on the walls of the shower to give them a bit of privacy. so if you are travelling with a friend, you might request a room with twin beds. But for couples, we highly recommend the glass shower - I would give the hotel the next highest rating just for that. Very unique. Others mentioned taking the train to the airport - but there is also a bus for 4-5 euros that leaves approx every 20 mins from the train station. A five minute walk from the hotel so very convenient. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great but Poor Air Con”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, in a great location near to Atocha station in a nice quiet area. It's only 30 min walk max to Sol or the Gran Via. The hotel interior is lovely with a modern style and I liked walking past the lavender garden and olive trees as I went to my room. The room itself was great and loved the wet room bathrooms - the free minibar was also a bonus and well used on our trip, as the air con in the room was the only thing that didn't work, it was like sauna when we entered and it never got the room cool the whole stay. We reported twice to the reception and they never really did anything about it, so we gave up. I noticed all the rooms had windows open so I would guess this was a wider problem than our room! This was the only thing that let the hotel down for us, it didn't spoil it just meant that I was hotter and didn't sleep as well as I'd expected too in the nice surroundings.. I would consider going back at the right price when I go to Madrid again, plus would try other AC hotels too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Atocha”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night here during a recent visit so I could catch a train to Barcelona the next day. Room was excellent, very modern and slick, free minibar is a great plus. Lots of amenities in the room. Although the room isn't big, they make good use of the space. Loved the shower, but I traveled solo. Breakfast was excellent, lots of great choices and well maintained. Service was...professional. Nothinig bad at all, but everyone seems so very grim. Not a smile out of the whole bunch. This hotel has two big negatives though, charging for wifi in the room is crazy. Marriott should give this prehistoric practice up already. Also I asked about getting a hot meal before 8pm and was told (by one of the grim professionals) No hot food until 8pm. Period. Kind of a crazy thing to say to a customer who is willing to pay the crazy hotel prices for food. Again, a business hotel should probably be a little bit more flexible. I can't complain though, my visit here was fine and I used a free night certificate from Marriott so it was well worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice Hotel. Direct train from Antocha station to airport.”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2225
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for 3 nights and we love it. The location was very good. It only 3-4 minutes walk to the Atoch Renfe train station which is good for take a train to Toledo and the airport. It also close to all the tourist area. You can just get direct train from this train station to airport without have to change the train. The hotel staff was very helpful. We love the room. It was nice, clean and roomy. The bed was so comfortable. We love the design and the shower. The other good thing is the free mini bar which you get free coke, juice an beer. They refill refrigerator everyday. If you ask for direction to the hotel please make sure that you show them the address. I asked 2 people included the police and they only read the word AC hotel and they gave me the direction to the AC Carlton Hotel near by. We are the Mariott Gold memebership and we get a free internet during our stay. They did not offer to us when we check in but when we ask if we get anything for being the gold member, so she gave us a free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden”
Reviews.Author: Capuccino18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located off on a side street. Our cab driver was a little confused trying to get us there. Loved the decor - very modern. As stated, free wi-fi in the lobby. We stayed in the back building and loved it. We had a little trouble finding out how to get down to the hallway to get there however. The front desk did not explain which floor to push on the elevator. It appears to be common, because while using the wi-fi in the lobby we watched multiple people get off and on looking confused. I had hoped the shower would have some kind of fog effect once you got in there, but no, it stays see thru. So depending on how comfortable you are with the people you are traveling with, you may want to wait in the lobby or take a nap while the shower is in use. The room was spacious and the beds were extremely comfy. Breakfast was delicious and the items were kept filled. Lots of fresh fruits. The front desk staff seemed a little disconnected. Not rude, but not helpful from the get go. Seemed to be in the back room often and we usually had to wait for them to come to the front. The Atocha station was a quick walk up the street and is filled with a bunch of shops. I would definitely stay here again. Now that I know how to find it, I would be okay taking the train straight from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Great Service, but Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sail2fun
Reviews.Content: In a very good location near the train station and some of the major attractions. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was nice, but you could hear everything going on in the hall way making sleep difficult. Having said that, I would stay here again. Free wi fi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, stylish”
Reviews.Author: DoctorToxic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in two separate buildings linked by a covered walkway, so you may need to take two lifts and a short walk from reception if you're in the rear building. Great rooms (7th floor suite with large balcony), recently refurbished with modern design. Free minibar was a great plus. Breakfast was OK, if a little chaotic and short of staff - tables not cleared, buffet not replenished. Staff were efficient and helpful, but very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice but ...”
Reviews.Author: Cymroardaith
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because we got a good deal on-line £240 for two people for three nights including breakfast. It's not on one of Madrid's nicest streets but the Atocha railway and metro stations are a mere two minute walk from the hotel. Paseo del Prado - home to a number of Madrid's most desirable attractions - is less than a 10 minute walk away. The hotel is modern, clean and very comfortable. We had a delightfully quiet room overlooking the hotel garden. Each room has a free mini-bar replenished daily with soft drinks which was a lovely touch. It's a shame the free wi-fi doesn't reach the bedrooms but the hotel has a sizeable lounge with free wi-fi which we used at least twice a day. As other guests have noted, the glass shower cubicle is located in the bedroom itself which may not be to everyone's taste but the choice of shower sprays was great as was the powerful water pressure. Breakfast was an entensive buffet which included a good variety of meats, cheeses, youghurts, breads, cakes etc. The juices and hot beverages were also of good quality. Check-in and out was fast and easy and the staff were efficient, helpful and friendly. One of the breakfast staff greeted us when he passed out during a stroll around the city. Having been tempted to spend at least another £150 on more expensive hotels, we were very happy that we'd settled on this one and would return tomorrow if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary decor, maybe not for seniors”
Reviews.Author: ala13
Reviews.Content: We (a mature couple) stayed at the hotel in March 2012 en route to Mijas Costa. The main reason was proximity to the train station as we were planning to take the train to Malaga where we were renting a car. The hotel design is contemporary with lot of chrome, dark wood and spot lights. Free WiFi is available in the lobby and at additional cost in the room. There is a restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to look at, but not a quiet hotel...”
Reviews.Author: scotborderstraveller
Reviews.Content: A 2 night stay for business. Reception was clean and well staffed - the check-in staff spoke excellent English and explained things clearly. When taxis were booked by reception they were there at the allotted time. Good Points: The hotel seems clean and recently refurbished with a reasonable selection of facilities for someone travelling for business. The location was adequate for my needs and close to the railway station with good links to the airport etc. The room was very modern and well equipped - TV, wi-fi (albeit expensive). OK - so a glass shower cubicle in the middle of the room may well not be to everyone's taste, but the room seemed clean and well presented. Complimentary mini-bar (mainly soft drinks and water) was a nice touch and was re-stocked for the second night. Large comfortable bed, a decent selection of TV / Radio channels and decent air-conditioning which ran very silently. In room safe and a good desk to work at. Complimentary wi-fi in the hotel lobby / lounge. Bad Points: The hotel was not quiet at all - the walls between rooms seemed very thin indeed, but the worst part had to be the impact noise from people walking on the wooden floors in the rooms. Whilst the wall-to-wall wood / laminate flooring in the bedrooms looked "modern" it transmitted every noise in the room and acted to just amplify every sound - doors slamming, people wheeling suitcases, snoring, coughing, talking etc. The road outside the window never quietened down and refuse collection took place very noisely outside at 3am both mornings. I had little if any sleep on both nights as a result. In the lounge the next morning, a colleague and I wanted coffee whilst we were working - this wasn't available whilst breakfast was being served (until 11am) which isn't great, Alot of business people having meetings in the lounge at 9am would probably have been happy to have had the option to order a coffee. The only solution was to go to the restaurant and buy two cups (small and expensive) and bring them back in the elevator - no good atall (they would not give me a tray to use). In Summary: Looks good, but not for those wanting a good nights sleep! Another example of form before function in hotel room furnishing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the station, but not as good as other ACs”
Reviews.Author: wineguru_12
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on a train and easily found the hotel. It is just a short walk from Atocha station. I have stayed in a number of AC hotels over the years and just love them in general, but this one let the side down a bit. Check in was nonchalent and bored, the room was fine, clean and everything as it should be, but the free minibar has been toned down, it only had a couple of bottles in it, and the TV was tiny. Still, I slept fine and cant complain about the price.

Reviews.Title: “stay in march”
Reviews.Author: agata83
Reviews.Content: very average experience.not that easy to find even coming from the main train station.arrived around 12 -i requested and early check in .long queue.reception staff not very helpful-im coming from the hospitality business so maybe i have higher expectations - i felt ignored when two members of staff started speaking Spanish to each other about not giving me an upgrade as my room was not ready ( i only speak a little Spanish but my partner is fluent) and the reasons behind it.i was only informed that ill be staying in room 126 and the mini bar is free.room was ok.nice,not big,quiet .the shower was a surprise thou.walls really thin and the housekeeping is loud in the morning.hotel has an amazing location.walking distance to the major attractions.bartender( argentinian ?) was very nice.we spend one evening there and that was relaxing.departure easy - just one small thing.i was rushing ,the weekend was busy ,departure was early -i asked for the postcard to be send.it never arrived.need to try a little harder :)

Reviews.Title: “Shower Stall Exhibitionism, Comfortable, Modern, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: BZT
Reviews.Content: From our party of 3 families, we found a variety of "shower stall exhibitionism". If a room had one large bed to share, the modernistic stone and glass walled shower stall was open and visible to the entire room; togetherness even in bathing (toilet was in a more private compound). If a room had two separate beds, perhaps not for sharing, we found the stall walls were obscured out; like those censored videos the networks often show. All in all we did find courtesy and good communication (English) among the staff. Location is in a residential neighborhood but good restaurants were just a block away; and the Atocha train station but a couple of blocks beyond

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs more English orientation”
Reviews.Author: MomentsNotice
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 night stay. Mixed results but generally I liked the property and AC chain very much. Location near the main Madrid station and Reina Sophia Museum--about 20 min walk to Puerta del Sol. First of all, someone on another site mentioned difficulty in finding hotel. I arrived by train and as train approached station (from the left side of train) I saw the AC logo on top of the hotel so I had a pretty good idea how to approach hotel but here is good directions. 1) be sure to exit Atocha station at "Salida Mendez Alvaro". That exit is on the MAIN floor, below Train Arrivals floor. 2) Exit building and walk past all the taxis. Walk through arch to street and you will be on Mendez Alvaro street. Turn Left. 3) walk 5 minutes following the brick wall of the station (turnoff is 2 full blocks). Brick wall will turn to glass and cement wall, keep going. A few feet after glass ends look across the street and you will see a building on the corner of Medenz Alvara with a huge "20" etched into the building. Turn Right. There is no street sign there but that is Calle Delicias. If you peak around the corner you will see the hotel (look at the top of the building for a huge AC sign. This is literally a 5-7 minute walk from the Mendez Alvaro Exit of the Station. If you use another exit you will have to walk all around the station to find the hotel. As MR platinum I received an upgrade to superior room. Larger room with couch, floor to ceiling windows along one long side, large outdoor patio (no chairs for enjoying it though). Hotel and room decor is very very attractive but sometimes impractical. AC seems to be trying to emulate the Starwood W brand. Others have noted the glass shower in the center of the room. Lovely but very impractical for 2+ persons sharing a room if they are not intimate. Room had a safe, bathrobe, slippers. Open closet. Proper hangers. Only one electrical outlet near desk. Lighting subdued and difficult to read/see when you are working at the desk at night. I asked for a standing lamp or another desk lamp and my first request went unanswered. I asked again and the maintenance man brought up a stronger bulb but it was not much stronger. I stopped pushing and just lived with low lights. Platinum amenity was a jar of nuts, a jar of candy (i think it might have been chocolate covered nuts--not sure) or 250 points. These were same offerings as other ACs so it may be standard. I think Marriott could do better. I took the points. Internet was good for a hotel but they do inhibit streaming so I was not able to access my Schwab Edge account. Not sure if that would affect streaming on other sites. Skype worked ok--not great but I've had worse. Internet was free for me as platinum--I believe price is 20euros for 24 hours but the time does not have to be consecutive. There is free internet in the lobby for all. I did not see a hotel computer for guests to use. Breakfast was great. Large selection, freshly squeezed juice,typical spanish breakfast which I enjoyed very much. Free minibar was a nice touch although I tend to drink a lot of water so I still had to lug water from the grocery store. Minibar included 2 small still waters, 1 sparking water, 1 each peach juice, orange juice, tonic water, fanta, coke, coke light, San Miguel especial beer, a non alcoholic beer. I think if you ask at the desk they will stock minibar with your preferences each day but I did not ask. Things I wish the room had: --alarm clock or any kind of clock. --coffee or hot water pot (rare to find at all but 5* hotels in spain) --better lighting near desk (see above) --this room (5th floor) had a huge terrace. In better weather I hope they put chairs outside for people to enjoy the terrace. and lastly: -- As AC is now part of Marriott more and more Americans will be staying at their properties. I stayed at 3 AC's on this trip and none had an English newspaper (even one on a pole in lobby would have been better than nothing). All had only BBC and CNN which to me are useless stations. I think it's time for AC to add CNBC and/or Bloomberg particularly if they are trying for a business clientele. Also, they need better English speaking front desk clerks. We could barely communicate. They appeared to understand me but in view of the multiple error in info I received and on my bill I don't think they did. And someone changed one of my nights which was booked at a weekend rate to an award night without my requesting (or wanting) such. I don't know if he misunderstood something I said or did it by accident or why. My bill had multiple errors when I checked out. And when my Marriott points posted only points for one night posted even though 3 of my 4 nights were paid rates. But overall a good hotel and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for hungry people”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: Tasteful modern decor and open plan room design is nice but if you're in need of food or drink in the evening stock up on your patience. For 2 nights I waited nearly 30 minutes for a waitress to appear so I could order something. Reminders to the indifferent reception staff didn't appear to have any effect. And then the food was tepid. Followed by another wait for a bill. Glad it was a work trip as I'd have been really upset if I'd paid myself. But then I suppose I wouldn't have been exhausted and only wanting to eat and collapse into bed...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Drroady
Reviews.Content: This was the third AC Marriott property I stayed in within a 2 week period; again, very, very nice. Everything about the hotel was wonderful, but I did have a very difficult time finding it when I exited the train station. Yes, it's close to the station, but one needs to be mindful of the fact that Atocha probably has 40+ exits. The hotel is located on a hidden, dark street, and seemed to generally be in a poor part of town. Since it was cold and dark, I finally hailed a cab to take me to the hotel. Rooms were ultra comfy, large balcony, quick checkin/checkout, excellent bar, etc. I learned from previous AC visits not to even try the breakfast "buffet," so cannot comment on this particular one. All in all a wonderful place for the money. Now that I know exactly where it is located, I'll walk from the train station, morning or night.

Reviews.Title: “Location good or bad.”
Reviews.Author: Reasonableness
Reviews.Content: The best and worse part this hotel is location. Bad - a 20 minute walk to Prado Museum on a slight but steady incline. To go to areas of tapa bars and restWaurants (tourist areas) may 30 minutes on cobblestones and slight uphill. Good - right next to Atocha train station where buses from airport and most trains end up. Very quiet, which is needed after a long, noisy day in Madrid. Close to metro stations that can take you any where in city and avoid the long walks. On balance, I vote yes, especially if you're not into the partying scene. Lots of quiet, non-tourists tapa bars around. Nice courtyard. Free (!) minibar with comes, beer, water. Helpful people. Clean neighborhood. Close to modern art museum (Reina) which is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “sehr modern! Good for romance, business, feeling cool”
Reviews.Author: dilan52
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good deals online often; very very modern, glassy, great shower, we had a good and helpful staff member give us restaurant advice. Quiet, lovely, very good breakfast buffet on Sunday for weary international travelers (15 euros, expensive, but great for a slow day in Madrid--and with yoghurt!). It's very VERY close to the train station-you can walk there, even with luggage from the station. Just get directions from the station. Close to Prado, shopping streets, and botanical gardents (all walking distance). You can also take a train or relatively cheap taxi from Atocha to the other main train station, Chamartin--the hotel staff helped arrange that for us.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Courtney G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for couples or for business travelers. Not ideal for families. The shower is the highlight of the room. The wifi worked great in the lobby, you have to pay for it in your room. The lighting and colors are really cool. We really just loved everything about it, esp the modern look and feel. The location was close to the train station and metro, making all of Madrid easily accessible, including the airport (plan about an hour to get from the hotel to the airport via the metro, but only costs about 2,50 Euros). Loved this hotel, will definitely stay here next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Average to low.”
Reviews.Author: melosh
Reviews.Content: The best I can say about this hotel is that it was clean & met our needs for an inexpensive, convenient bed for one night… and it had a decent hairdryer. We stayed here on our last night in Madrid and chose it for 3 reasons. 1. It was near Atocha , as we were coming in on the AVE from Barcelona later in the evening & leaving for the airport in the morning 2. They had a good price 3. I figured with Marriott brand name you can usually be guaranteed a decent bed & shower. I have to say this is a weird hotel - It is actually in 2 buildings , we had a room in the one furthest from the main desk- You go in to the lobby then have to switch lifts, walk through a conference center, outside then to another set of lifts. It was kind of a hassle with the large luggage we had. It would have been great to have at least an exit to the street from that building. The décor is very masculine & austere- to say the least. All black /grey, metal…I like modern, but this was cold. The real tipping point for this place with me was the shower. I see others mention it but it really doesn’t do it justice. .. I don’t know what they were thinking . I guess you could call it a "show shower", yes that would be appropriate. It seemed like it was designed for Tokyo Love Motel ( not that I have been in one ) but it just seemed more peep show /hourly hotel than a 4* hotel. The shower is encased in clear glass smack in the middle of the room. – they could at least provide a curtain or something . Also the floor of it was gridded metal , which hurt my feet - after 2+ weeks of walking Madrid. Lisbon & Barcelona my feet were a bit more sensitive than usual and this was not welcome. This hotel IS close to Atocha Railstation but not that close to the Metro. There was a lot of noise in the hallway, and our window was broken from the outside when we woke up. The staff was accommodating , not overly friendly but not rude either. I am glad we were there only one night - if this was the accommodation I chose for my entire time in Madrid- I would have been highly disappointed and most likely sought out an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendi404
Reviews.Content: The first thing to note is the AC Hotel Atocha by Marriott is in a terrific location if you want to be in a neighborhood and near the Metro and train station. It is simple to get to from the airport (about a 45 minute Metro ride) and has lots of dining around the hotel. It is also close to the Prado and about a 20 minute walk to the Puerta del Sol (although we are fast walkers). We stayed in the hotel for five nights using my Marriott points. Our room was in the annex building that meant you had to take the elevator down one level, walk outside and then take the elevator in the second building to your room. Although many of the reviews talk about balconies and leather couches we had neither. Our room was small but clean, neat and modern. It was nice having the free mini bar in your room full of refreshments and it was restocked daily. The king bed was comfortable and had nice linens. The reason I marked this as a three star was this because the second night of our stay the hotel became very noisy at night/early a.m. Running, slamming doors and yelling in the hall at all hours. I did call multiple times to complain but did not get any relief from this early morning noise until our final night when at 3:30 a.m. there was a girl kicking the doors in the hall and screaming for someone to wake up and come out and party some more. This time I when called the desk and they did come up and stop the noise but it was annoying having this issue for days and never have a manager acknowledge that they were sorry we dealt with it night-after-night. Another thing was the front desk was only mildly helpful with directions/suggestions and the hotel did not have a concierge on duty during our stay. We sought other resources to get answers and suggestions to our questions during our time in Madrid. One last note worth mentioning is the shower. It is clear glass to the room. This would definitely not be suitable if you were staying as a family in the room or with friends who you don’t want to parade around in front of naked. This is the second hotel I’ve stayed at this year with this open bathroom setting – hopefully not a full on trend in the future ;)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and sexy - with a rather funky layout but great location”
Reviews.Author: volksaudinut
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed over a weekend at this hotel in one of their Junior Suites in the Lacy Building (there are two separate buildings for this hotel). We chose the hotel due to AC Hotels now participating in Marriott's Rewards Program and we really enjoyed nearly every aspect of our stay. Let's start with the only negative - and that was the two-building setup which was a bit confusing and necessitated two elevators rides and a bit of a walk to get to our room. Other than that, there are only postive things: -truly comfortable bed: ours was an actual King-size bed (not two twins pushed together) -sexy,modern decor: very IKEA/Z. Gallerie - grays, blacks, lots of glass - all very clean and new -a parking garage almost exclusive to the hotel: a very rare find in a big European city and made our arrival and departure so much easier (also SUPER close to a major train station, Atocha) -a free minibar re-stocked daily with waters, juices, sodas, and beers -nice toiletries and towels, a 1600-watt hairdryer, and the coolest shower (true though that it doesn't afford much privacy - not an issue for solo travelers or couples) -back to that shower: rain-shower head, plus a hand-held sprayer, plus three jets, ambient lighting, and smoked mirrors - awesome -leather couch and flat-screen TVs in the room -our room had the largest balcony (more like a wraparoung terrace) that overlooked the southwest and afforded us great views of sunrise and sunset and total privacy -friendly, English-speaking staff We didn't try out the hotel's restaurant or fitness center, as we were too busy happily exploring the amazing city or Madrid and its people, sidewalk cafes, museums, and parks. You'll want to do the same - don't limit yourself to hotel food and fitness. Great location and safe, clean and new property. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: phil82_11
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & i stayed here for 2 nights and could find no faults at all! Rooms were spacious and modern, with an amazing shower set up! Beds were big and comfy (proper kings size rather than 2 singles pushed together) Hotel is in a fantastic location for those people wanting to be outside of the night life areas of town. Metro to Sol was about 5 minutes, or you can walk it in about 15 Would definately recommend this hotel to others and will stay here again next time i visit madrid

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Paulette312
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the AC Atocha and found it very pleasant. The three rooms that we used there had an IKEA kind of feel to them. One of the perks was that the beverages in the refrig were free and replaced daily. We were just two blocks from the train station and about four blocks from the Prado and Retiro Park. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Seeking_Adventure88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at this hotel and I have nothing bad to say at all! Free mini bar - excellent! Beautiful room, comfortable bed, great amenities. The room we stayed in had a beautiful view of a garden and the windows opened all the way to let in the fresh air at night (I believe it was room 1007? not sure) Close to the train/metro station. Free wifi in the lobby and lounge. I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Worst business hotel EVER! Don't use this hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Michaelaeroe
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the hotel only to lean at the reception that we had to pay for the first 2 days in advance because they had to change their IT system. The people at the reception we not serviceminded at all. We asked for an iron for our cloths only to find out that this "business" hotel didn't have an iron!!!! Had to hand over shirts etc. to the laundry service who charged us EUR 50!! It was not their politics to have an iron available!!! Come on!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance from Atocha Renfe Station”
Reviews.Author: DrJB_08
Reviews.Content: Overall, the room is comfortable and it was very nice to have the complimentary free water/juice (beer, if you drink alcohol) replenished daily. The wifi, unfortunately, is only free in the lobby (otherwise it's 13 Euro daily for use in the room). The shower is nice, but like other visitors have commented, it is see-through (yet when it steams up, the glass fogs and it is no longer see-through). I found the shower to be comfortable, but the flooring is steel with small holes cut out and so it may hurt some people's feet. One strange observation we made is that there is no one ever at the front desk. A huge negative point is that there is no iron in the room and you must use the laundry service to have anything pressed (no option for an iron to be delivered to the room). The TV channels in English include only news channels, BBC or CNN. A tip: This hotel is walking distance from the Atocha Renfe Station, where helpful passersby or officials will point you in the correct direction to walk there... do not be fooled and follow the huge "AC Hotels" billboard-type signage you can see from when you leave the stn and walk towards the hotel... that is the entrance to the parking garage; the hotel entrance is on the next street up and you will have to go all the way around and back to get to the front of the hotel if you follow that sign. Also, do not eat at the KFC in Puerta del Sol, blech! Our favorite sites: Retiro Park, especially the rowboat area, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, San Miguel Market, Prado, Reina Sofia Museums, and make a trip out to see a game at the football stadium and visit the Toledo cathedral if you have a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: glogae
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel at the end of December 2010. We choose it for the low price and the location, near the train station and the main museums. ROOM Then room are very beautiful, with a modern design. They are big with everything you need. The shower is completely transparent... If you are in the room with friends or colleagues it's quite embarrassing. However the style of the room is excellent if you like cold colors and modern design. In was very happy about it, also beause it was very clean. STAFF I don't appreciate a lot the staff at concierge... They asked me to pay in advance when we arrive because it was the end of the year. No way to reason with them. So I paid with credit card, but the girl at the desk was busy at the phone an she tried to debit me something like 53.000 euros!!! The credit card naturally refused the debit and she made other 2 attempts because she continued making mistakes. I was quite upset and I needed to call the Visa service center in order to be sure about the operation they made. In the end everything was fixed and paid the correct amount. BREAKFAST The breakfast was overpriced so we decided to eat something on the main street near the hotel. Good choice because we paid less than half for a good breakfast. LOCATION The location is very good in order to reach the train station and the biggest museum. Also the city center is easily reachable and you can visit all the main spots of the city without any problem. If you prefer the underground, you can find a station near the hotel. In the end, I can suggest the hotel for an holiday in Madrid. You will be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great design, great location”
Reviews.Author: PretPourPartir
Reviews.Content: The AC Atocha hotel is well situated beside the main Atocha train station. It is a new modern hotel with a large lobby, bar and reception area. It seems to cater to alot of business people. There are meeting rooms and the restaurant and gym on the lower courtyard level. We had a room on the top fifth floor facing the street with a huge balcony terrace measuring about 15 by 20 feet. Curiously, this balcony had no furniture nor plants, but we could sit on the rather wide ledge. The room itself was a good size, compact and decorated in greys, blacks, chorme and polished glass. The central point of the room was the glassed in shower stall. It separated the entrance to the room from the rest of the space and with its led lighting and 4 shower jets, it was a really show ! The room came with a complimentary mini bar that was replenished daily. There was water, plain and sparkling, coke, diet coke, fanta and 1 beer and 1 non-alcholic beer. It was a nice touch as we always had something to drink, especially at the end of a hot day. The room had no closed in storage, just open shelves and 2 separate rods to hang clothes. As usual, there were not enough hangers, but we asked at the front desk and housekeeping delivered the extra hangers right away. There was safe for valuables and an extra duvet and pillows. The flooring was dark wood with a medium sized black and white rug underneath the coffee table. The bed was king sized and very comfortable. At the foot of the bed was a large leather couch with a glass coffee table. One nice touch was the fact that the air conditioning did not shut off when we took our room key out of the control slot by the door. We’ve been in other places where this is not the case, and we you get back to the room, it is like an oven. The staff was polite, very helpful and spoke English very well. This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Reina Sofia Museum of Modern Art as well as the main Atocha train station and metro stop. We went jogging several times in El Retiro Park which is just on the other side of the train station from the hotel. We like to walk, so it was no problem for us the walk to the Prado, the Gran Via or Puerta del Sol, all which were about 20 minutes away by foot. We also took the metro from Atocha. The neighborhood is very quiet, safe and non-touristy. There were 2 supermarkets both about 5 minutes away as well as several cafes and restaurants. We ate the breakfast once at the hotel. The limited selection of fruit, cheeses, meats and breads were of a good quality. The hotel claims to have a gym, but we discovered that the «gym» was 2 bikes and a treadmill and maybe a big swiss ball. Don’t waste your time, go jogging in El Retiro park instead. We recommend this hotel for its location, its cleanliness, service and its chic and modern design ( plus the complimentary mini bar ).

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: David123456789
Reviews.Content: Stylish, modern and reasonably priced hotel near Atocha. Metro is a five-ten minute walk away and you can walk to plenty of places too like the Prado and Reina Sofia. The room was big and there was a FREE mini bar, something I've never seen before or after! Free wifi in lobby but not in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Clean”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsYouAll
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 2011. Very modern with many nice amenities including a FREE mini bar refilled every day, a refrigerator, and a large safe for valuables. Clean rooms and professional staff. There are two buildings, I stayed in the building further from the street and it was very quiet although a longer walk to the lobby/exit. If you take the BUS from the Madrid airport (only 2 Eurors!) you can take it right to the Atocha Station. Take the BACK entrance/exit in the Atocha station which is much closer to the Atocha AC Hotel than the Station's main entrance. The Hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Prado Museum and Reitro Park. If you're in good shape you can walk to the Plaza Mayor. The only negative is that the shower is see-through so there is no privacy.

Reviews.Title: “It's greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: HoneyThailand
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by asking our business company to help. We have only idea to stay in hotel near railway station because it's convenient to go to anywhere. When we open the room, we saw smallroom in the center which 4 walls made of GLASS. Wow! it's sexiest shower room that we have never seen before. So nice for Moneymoon couple but not our couple who are nearly 50 years old :) This room is another buiding which is back from Front building

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just outside the absolute city center”
Reviews.Author: T-Frandzen
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is located near the main train station on a busy and uncharming road, but the hotel itself is excellent. Service was fine, breakfast was one of the best I've ever had at a hotel, not because the selection was huge (which it wasn't) but because it was of a great quality - various yoghurts, fine local meats (among them some local specialty cured ham and lomos), good bread, etc. Room was quite large, but then it was upgraded from standard and had tons of free space - almost too large for one person. The bed was excellent as was the bathroom w/ spa. A ten to fifteen minute walk takes you to the three big art museums of Madrid, and the Atocha metro station is also nearby. You can walk to most major sights of the city in half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite AC Yet!”
Reviews.Author: Cat_in_Rabat
Reviews.Content: Less than 10 minutes from Atocha by foot, this is a fabulous hotel. Great service, great location, great big comfy bed. The outstanding feature of the rooms is its glass-walled shower, so if you're planning on sharing a room with your mother-in-law, don't.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern and confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PedroMelo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel! It is located less than 5 minutes from Atocha train station and Reina Sofia museum, in a nice, calm and secure neighborhood. The hotel has 2 building conected by a modern winter garden. The atmosphere and style are veru modern and sophisticated, with design furniture everywhere. The staff are very helpfull and friendly. The rooms are also very modern and stylish with plasma Tv on the wall, free minibar!, The bathroom is a amazing, with a transparent design shower cabin!!! with separated WC. there are also a free safe box and several amenities. we booked through bookings and payed 90 euros per night! (but without breakfirst)!

Reviews.Title: “New and Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knabberbox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night during a round trip in central spain. Hotel and rooms were really nice and new. Very nice rainshower (glass shower cubicle) and comfortable double beds. We got an excellent (opening?) rate, so value for mpney was great. We skipped the expensive breakfast. Otherwise there is a free mini bar in the room! Location quite good if you arrive by train: Within a 5 minute walk from main station. Museum Reina Sofia just nearby. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel I've ever been in, hands down. But don't go if you're shy!”
Reviews.Author: VivaLaDiva405
Reviews.Content: If you've ever wanted to experience a truly modern hotel, the epitome of sleek, almost stark design, this is it! We stayed just one night but the walk from the main reception/building to the second building was one of the most of memorable parts of the night. Dark hallways, but with bright lights highlighting modern art pieces the whole way through. And the room! Monochromatic to the core, but the design just works. And not to bury the lead, but that transparent shower is a trip and half. It is COMPLETELY transparent. There might be a switch or something to make it opaque, but like most every hotel in Spain, none of the light switches are labeled. Not that we looked for it... The point is, this is for single travelers, or couples. Not with friends or family. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern in a developing area”
Reviews.Author: rickfisher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in early October 2010. Just south of Atocha station with a lot of building work in the surrounding area. 400 yards from Atocha metro station, so easy to get anywhere. Smooth check-in and out and staff were always helpful and attentive. Room is very modern and comfortable. Shower takes a bit of getting used to. Free mini bar is a nice touch. Nice terrace to sit out on, but no pool. Basic gym. We were room only for £60 per night, but breakfast looked good. Good local bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Comfortable and Central”
Reviews.Author: Paula_Dublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very modern, located really close to central amenitites and a stones throw from main train station. Rooms are really modern decorated, very clean. I loved them very chic! The toilet is behind a black glass wall so you cant see in the shower is a seperate good size cubicle in the middel of the bedroom surrounded by a clear glass wall...which I really liked but might not suit all. Gym is basic treadmill etc, Brekkie was great big choice and excellent coffee so thumbs up from me.

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Atocha by Marriott
